basics.name: David PIATEK
basics.label: Lead Developer - DevOps - Backend Developer
basics.summary:
Father of two, living in the countryside, I have built a strong personal and professional balance that helps me handle pressure and the fast-paced nature of the tech industry with calm and clarity.

Passionate about technology from an early age, I built my career around software development before moving into Tech Lead roles. This experience led me to work across application architecture, software quality and infrastructure, and gradually develop a strong interest in DevOps.

Today, I work with a holistic product mindset, combining development, DevOps and automation, in a context where AI accelerates delivery cycles. I position myself as a product builder, at the intersection of development, DevOps and product.

work.summary: Freelance missions focused on PHP/Symfony development, process automation and DevOps practices.
As a freelance engineer, I took ownership of a legacy system in order to modernize it and deploy it on Azure.
As a Tech Lead, I led my squad. Working closely with the Product Owner and Test Manager, I helped define specifications and ensured technical feasibility.
My initial mission was to maintain the existing platform while adding new features. I later recruited a new team and led a full redesign, including infrastructure and architecture.
highlights: Rebuilding the stack after the OVH fire

work.summary: Defined product direction and implemented architecture and DevOps practices for building an ERP/CRM dedicated to small businesses.
Worked on turning PrestaShop into a SaaS product by securing and optimizing features, migrating customers off the SaaS offering, and contributing to the new monetization system.

In an early-stage startup, I built the team and ensured knowledge transfer from external providers. We designed out-of-the-box solutions to enable communication between the website and notary software.
As a full-stack developer, I worked with multiple PHP technologies (Joomla, Symfony) and built web services (REST and SOAP).
Business management, photography, and photo development.
